pbs-job-attribute.name: Account_Name

attribute-definition.description: Account to which to charge this job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: string

pbs-job-attribute.name: Checkpoint

attribute-definition.description: Determines when checkpointing (if supported) will be performed by PBS on behalf of the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: the strings "n" (no checkpointing), "s" (to be performed only when the server executing the job is shutdown), "c" (to be performed at the default minimum time for the server executing the job), "c=mmmm" (to be performed at an interval of minutes which is the integer number of minutes of CPU time used by the job; value must be greater than zero); default value: "u", which is unspecified.

pbs-job-attribute.name: depend

attribute-definition.description: The type of inter-job dependencies specified by the job owner.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "type:jobid[,jobid...]"; default value: no dependencies.

pbs-job-attribute.name: destination

attribute-definition.description: Designation of the queue to which to submit the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: queue[@server].

pbs-job-attribute.name: directive

attribute-definition.description: Defines the prefix that declares a directive to the qsub command within the script file.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: See the paragraph on script directives in the Extended Description section. If the option is presented with a directive_prefix argument that is the null string, qsub will not scan the script file for directives.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Error_Path

attribute-definition.description: The final path name for the file containing the job's standard error stream.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "[hostname:]pathname". If the option is not specified, the default file name for the standard error stream will be used. The default name has the following form: job_name.eSeq_num where job_name is the name of the job, see -N option, and Seq_num is the job number assigned when the job is submitted; default value: (job_name).e(job_number).

attribute-definition.description: Declares that all environment variables in the qsub command's environment are to be exported to the batch job.

pbs-job-attribute.name: group_list

attribute-definition.description: A list of group_names@hosts which determines the group under which the job is run on a given host.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: group_name[@host][,group_name[@host]...]. When a job is to be placed into execution, the server will select a group name according to the following ordered set of rules: 1) Select the group name from the list for which the associated host name matches the name of the execution host; 2) Select the group name which has no associated host name, the wildcard name; 3) Use the login group for the username under which the job will be run.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Hold_Types

attribute-definition.description: The set of holds currently applied to the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: If the set is not null, the job will not be scheduled for execution and is said to be in the hold state. Note, the hold state takes precedence over the wait state. Format: string made up of the letters 'u', 's', 'o'; default value: no hold.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Job_Name

attribute-definition.description: The name assigned to the job by the qsub or qalter command.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: string up to 15 characters, first character must be alphabetic; default value: the base name of the job script or STDIN.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Join_Path

attribute-definition.description: Merge stdout and stderr into stdout.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: boolean, values accepted are "True", "TRUE", "true", "Y", "y", "1", "False", "FALSE", "false", "N", "n", "0"; default value: false.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Keep_Files

attribute-definition.description: Retain these streams on the execution host upon job termination.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "o", "e", "oe" or "eo"; default value: no keep, return files to submission host.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Mail_Points

attribute-definition.description: Identifies at which state changes the server will send mail about the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: string made up of the letters 'a' for abort, 'b' for beginning, and default value: 'a', send on job abort.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Mail_Users

attribute-definition.description: The set of users to whom mail may be sent when the job makes certain state changes.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Output_Path

attribute-definition.description: The final path name for the file containing the job's standard output stream.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "[hostname:]pathname". If the option is not specified, the default file name for the standard error stream will be used. The default name has the following form: job_name.oSeq_num where job_name is the name of the job, see -N option, and Seq_num is the job number assigned when the job is submitted; default value: (job_name).o(job_number).

pbs-job-attribute.name: Priority

attribute-definition.description: The job scheduling priority assigned by the user.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "[+|-]nnnnn"; default value: undefined.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Rerunnable

attribute-definition.description: The rerunnable flag assigned by the user.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: "y" or "n", see Join_Path; default value: y, job is rerunable.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.arch

attribute-definition.description: Specifies the administrator defined system architecture requried.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: This defaults to whatever the PBS_MACH string is set to in "local.mk". Units: string.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.cput

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of CPU time used by all processes in the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: [[hours:]minutes:]seconds[.milliseconds].

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.file

attribute-definition.description: The largest size of any single file that may be created by the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: integer[suffix]; the suffix is a multiplier in bytes or words (word size of the host): b (bytes), w (words), kb/kw (kilo), mb/mw (mega), gb/bw (giga).

attribute-definition.description: Name of host on which job should be run.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.mem

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of memory used by all concurrent processes in the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: integer[suffix]; the suffix is a multiplier in bytes or words (word size of the host): b (bytes), w (words), kb/kw (kilo), mb/mw (mega), gb/bw (giga).

attribute-definition.description: Total number of cpus/cores to be allocated to the job.
The nice value under which the job is to be run.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.nodes

attribute-definition.description: Number and/or type of nodes to be reserved for exclusive use by the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: The value is one or more node_specs joined with the '+' character, "node_spec[+node_spec...]. Each node_spec is a number of nodes required of the type declared in the node_spec and a name or one or more properity or properities desired for the nodes. The number, the name, and each properity in the node_spec are separated by a colon ':'. If no number is specified, one (1) is assumed. Units: string. The name of a node is its hostname. The properties of nodes are: ppn=# requested; defaults to 1; or an arbitrary string defined by system administrator. Example: To ask for 2 processors on each of two blue nodes and three processors on one red node: -l nodes=2:blue:ppn=2+red:ppn=3.

attribute-definition.description: Number of threads per processor for Open MP jobs.

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.pcput

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of CPU time used by any single process in the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: [[hours:]minutes:]seconds[.milliseconds].

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.pmem

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of physical memory (workingset) used by any single process of the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: integer[suffix]; the suffix is a multiplier in bytes or words (word size of the host): b (bytes), w (words), kb/kw (kilo), mb/mw (mega), gb/bw (giga).

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.pvmem

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of virtual memory used by any single process in the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: integer[suffix]; the suffix is a multiplier in bytes or words (word size of the host): b (bytes), w (words), kb/kw (kilo), mb/mw (mega), gb/bw (giga).

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.vmem

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of virtual memory used by all concurrent processes in the job.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: integer[suffix]; the suffix is a multiplier in bytes or words (word size of the host): b (bytes), w (words), kb/kw (kilo), mb/mw (mega), gb/bw (giga).

pbs-job-attribute.name: Resource_List.walltime

attribute-definition.description: Maximum amount of real time during which the job can be in the running state.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: [[hours:]minutes:]seconds[.milliseconds].

pbs-job-attribute.name: Shell_Path_List

attribute-definition.description: A set of absolute paths of the program to process the job's script file.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: path[@host][,path[@host]...]. If this is null, then the user's login shell on the host of execution will be used. Default value: null, login shell.

pbs-job-attribute.name: stagein

attribute-definition.description: The list of files to be staged in prior to job execution.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: local_path@remote_host:remote_path.

pbs-job-attribute.name: stageout

attribute-definition.description: The list of files to be staged out after job execution.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: Format: local_path@remote_host:remote_path.

pbs-job-attribute.name: User_List

attribute-definition.description: The list of user@hosts which determines the user name under which the job is run on a given host.

pbs-job-attribute.tooltip: When a job is to be placed into execution, the server will select a user name from the list according to the following ordered set of rules: 1) Select the user name from the list for which the associated host name matches the name of the execution host; 2) Select the user name which has no associated host name, the wild card name; 3) Use the Job_Owner as the user name. Default value: job owner name.

attribute-definition.description: This is the list of environment variables passed with the Queue Job batch request.
